data.title: I'm still hungry
data.text: Portions are tiny.  Chicken is excellent. But after $30 I still was starved. These were anorexic chickens.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: This quaint restaurant has a nice vibe. Enjoyable Caribbean/African/Latin music. I enjoyed the Chicken and Baby Kale Salad. It has Baby kale, shredded chicken and crispy chickpeas mixed with greens, olives and cherry tomatoes, all tossed in a creamy yogurt dressing. I had a glass of Sangria to compliment the meal. If you never been to this restaurant, it's a must try.

data.title: Great chicken
data.text: Great chicken and portions. I got a salad with chicken to go and I thought it seemed small. But I was stuffed after the last bite. Nice to see they have proper portion control. The sauces and chicken are amazing. Love how quick they rang me up and brought my takeout order. Will come here for sure the next time I want a yummy salad. Great service as well!

data.title: Great chicken
data.text: Visited this unique restaurant for lunch.   The hostess assigns a table and gives you a menu.  Then you decide and walk to the counter to place your order.   The food is then delivered to your table.  I thought it was table service so I sat for a while before I noticed what others were doing.   The chicken Peri peri was succulent.  You can order at various spice levels.  The lemon herb was good and not at all hot.  My only criticism is the restaurant is very loud.  The acoustics made it difficult for conversation.

data.title: Unique taste
data.text: It is good restaurant who like spiced food. We tried Peri Peri chicken which was fresh and soft. Fries or chips was also unique with Chilli powder seasoning which was good

data.title: Lunch @ Nando's
data.text:
Well located and wonderful ambience

As usual great chicken and service
Would love to come back again
Peri Peri

data.title: Good food in a chill environment
data.text: I had heard about this place but never took the time to visit. Met a colleague hear for lunch and it is always fun to visit Old Town. Usually for lunch it is not that crowded around this part of town. The setting was cool and modern and you are welcomed from the moment you walk in and that was refreshing. You order at the counter and they bring your food to you. I ordered the boneless chicken breast which the restaurant describes as a "Succulent, butterflied whole chicken breast in crispy skin. No bones about it!" This seemed like a straightforward meal that would be a good starting point for me as a rookie at this place.  In addition I ordered the Portuguese Rice which is a spicy yellow rice with fresh peppers and herbs. You can also choose how spicy you want the food, and I went with the above average spiciness which was just fine for me but still not too overwhelming. The chicken and rice were very good, although I should have ordered one more side to fill me up a little more. Nonetheless, I will definitely be stopping back here to try the other dishes.

data.title: First time visit for  lunch
data.text: Great restaurant for lunch. I was in town for business & stumbled upon this local favorite. You order at the counter and the cashier assigns you a number to an open table. We had a window seat so could see Old Town foot traffic. Foot was fast and absolutely delicious. I had the grilled chicken breast with medium heat sauce and fries. Mouth-watering and filling. Definitely would recommend! !

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: Very spicy! I loved it but my kids did not except for the grilled corn on the cob...we actually had to order more because they liked it. We enjoyed the unlimited frozen yogurt!!

data.title: Group tour dinner
data.text: We stopped here with our group of 35. Buffet style chicken(plain), mashed potatoes, corn on the cob and salad. Several different sauces for your chicken. Unlimited soft drinks (self serve) and brownie for dessert. Really good for our group!

data.title: I wish it was as good as it is in South Africa
data.text: Nando's comes from SA, and there it is more fast food, but pretty good. Here they try to make it more formal, cook the chicken until its dry, and spike the sangria with Sprite, soa  bit of a let down.

user_location.name: Washington Dc, District Of Columbia, Usa

data.title: Great peri-peri chicken!
data.text:
We popped in for lunch on a Saturday.  Admittedly, this is not our first Nando's experience; we're frequent customers of Nandos restaurants in Europe.
The food Portions are very generous for the price paid.  The peri-peri is an amazing sauce, which provides excellent flavour.
This Nandos location is extremely convenient; located immediately on Kings Street (high street) and easy to find.  Seating downstairs is limited, but upstairs has ample room (as well as an additional till for ordering and getting drinks!).
I highly recommend a hummus starter!  Very fresh and smooth hummus, with very soft pita bread.

data.title: One of our Grandkids Favorites
data.text: An easy place to take young family members.  The food is simple but very good. The atmosphere is casual and relaxed.

data.title: Solid Meal
data.text: Went to Nando's with a student travel group. We had Chicken, Mashed Potatoes, and Corn. It was a very good meal especially being served buffet style. You have a choice of 5 or 6 sauces to go with the chicken. Very friendly wait staff. If in town worth a stop.

data.title: Fabulous chicken wings! Great service! And beautiful decor!
data.text:
First time on this restaurant.
It took me a little bit of time to understand the menu but the people there helped me a lot to decide what to order.
The chicken wings were fabulous ( naked) and I had hot sauce on the side. You have plenty of sauces to choose from. The wings were delicious , great flavor and very juicy and tender. Actually tasted like home when I cooked in the BBQ.
The nutty date chicken salad was amazing.
Had a side dish of mixed olives- great.
Love the atmosphere and the great positive energy in that place.
Our host, Tin Tin was excellent.  Very professional and very friendly.

data.title: I can't stop thinking about this chicken
data.text: Charred, thin, crispy skin over a beautifully moist and tender chicken breast, smothered in a tasty sauce.  I am in love and already thinking about going back for lunch tomorrow.  Order at the counter, choose your menu item and the level of spice for the sauce (I chose 'extremely hot' on a boneless Breast and lived to tell about it).  Two chicken breasts and a total of 3 sides plus 2 bottles of beer came to $40.  Worth every penny.

data.title: Good bang for your buck.
data.text: Besides a very efficient ordering and serving process this is the place for a really solid roast chicken lunch or dinner. The very limited wine choice works well for a chicken place. Also good for a quick lunch as one wonders down King St. Very family friendly.

data.title: Spicy delicious food
data.text: I love Nandos. I went to Nandos in a lot of country and it never disappointed me. If you like spicy food it is a really good place to go. The food is a mixture of American and South African food and it is delicious.

data.title: Not Impressed
data.text: Food was pretty good, but that was about it. Noisy, uncomfortable seating and ordering like you're at a fast food restaurant. That just didn't work for me, so I won't be returning.

data.title: Great but
data.text: This is great but they keep missing food when I order it. I order food and  drink and they forgot to change drinks. I ordered food for daughter and they do not ring up all items.minor issue but focus on getting orders correct please. Aside from that minor issue food is great!
